inclusion.criterion: Mini Asthma Quality of Life Questionnaire (Mini AQLQ)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: PRD-III Somatic Symptom Scale (PRD-III) for side effects
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: blood draw for routine laboratory analyses
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: forced expiratory volume in 1-second percentage of normal (FEV1%) will be assessed using a portable spirometer
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Self-reported asthma-related emergency room visits and hospitalizations will be quantified for the past 12 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participants will receive a clinical psychiatric evaluation by one of the investigators to confirm the diagnosis and that the participant meets entry criteria
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Steroid inhaler dose monitoring using the counter already included by the manufacturer will begin at this time
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: After the participant is determined to qualify, the steroid inhaler counter will be used to assess baseline adherence
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Severe or life threatening medical illness that would make completion of study unlikely (e.g. myocardial infarction)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 15-year-old boy with asthma diagnosed a year ago, presenting with shortness of breath, chest tightening and cough.
